items.title: V8 finds another 5-15% performance boost
items.content:
#â€‹540 â€” May 28, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Sparkplug: V8's Non-Optimizing JavaScript Compiler â€” When you wonder just where the V8 team will pull out a few more % of performance improvements, they come up with something :-). Their new â€˜super-fast non-optimizing compilerâ€™ in V8 v9.1 sits in between the existing interpreter and TurboFan compiler engines and brings another 5-15% boost to benchmarks. Firefox has had a similar concept in the shape of the baselineÂ interpreter.

Leszek Swirski (V8 Team)

Locate Front-End Issues Like JavaScript or Network Errors Instantly â€” Get proactively alerted on any client-side issues such as JavaScript and network errors, optimize the load time of your front-end resources, and detect any UI issues that affect critical user journeys. Try it free with DatadogÂ Synthetics.

Datadog sponsor

TypeScript 4.3 Released â€” Just a couple of weeks after the beta comes the real deal with a rather long featureÂ list:

  • An override keyword to explicitly define overridingÂ methods.
  • A --noImplicitOverride flag to make it an error to override methods in superclasses without using the aforementioned override.
  • Template string type improvements.
  • Methods and accessors can now be given private names, e.g. getÂ #someValue().
  • static index signatures.
  • And, yes, a lot more.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

Jest 27 Released, Complete with Some New Defaults â€” Jest has â€˜flipped some switchesâ€™ and introduced some new defaults youâ€™ll want to be aware of if you use the popular testing framework. You can now also interactively step through failed tests one at a time, get inline snapshots without using Prettier, and you get much faster initialization times than Jest 26Â too.

Tim Seckinger

Quick Bits

  • The Angular project has unveiled an improved process for managing featureÂ requests.
  • ğŸ‰ Node.js has turned 12 years old. You can still grab v0.0.1.
  • Flow is a JavaScript static type checker out of Facebook that saw a lot of growth before TypeScript ate everyone's lunch. The project has issued a post clarifying Flow's future direction which is basically "Flow is staying open source but is going to focus even more on Facebook's own useÂ cases."

Releases

fabric.js 4.5 â€” JS Canvas framework (and SVG to Canvas parser).
Chart.js 3.3 â€” Simple, flexible JS charting.
xstyled 3.0 â€” CSS-in-JS framework built for React.
Cypress 7.4.0 â€” Testing system.
ESLint 7.27.0 â€” Find and fix problems in your JavaScript.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior Frontend Engineer - Remote â€” Looking for a JS enthusiast who loves TypeScript, Next.js, and SSR. Let's build the future of financeÂ together.
Kikoff

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

â–¶Â Â How To Create Your First Flow in Node-RED â€” Node-RED is a browser-based â€˜flowâ€™ programming environment that uses Node.js under the hood. An interesting alternative way to build JavaScript powered systems.

Bleeding Code

A Thorough Analysis of CSS-in-JS â€” I feel too old-fashioned to fully buy into writing CSS alongside my JavaScript (sorry!) but Andrei does a good job at selling the benefits and compares someÂ approaches.

Andrei Pfeiffer

Build a Node.js App with CockroachDB and the Node.js pg Driver â€” In this tutorial youâ€™ll learn how to build a simple Node.js application with CockroachDB and the Node.js pgÂ driver.

Cockroach Labs sponsor

Building a Rich WYSIWYG Text Editor From Scratch â€” Learn how to build a rich text editor into an app with Slate doing the heavyÂ lifting.

Shalabh Vyas

The Modern Guide to React State Patterns â€” At one stage, you could basically just say â€˜use Reduxâ€™ but there are so many options now, and this guide flies through a fewÂ approaches.

Fredrik Strand Oseberg

New Standards to Access User Device Hardware from JavaScript â€” WebHID, WebNFC, and Web Serial have opened up new avenues to interact with userâ€™s device hardware for web apps. Device and browser support is kinda patchy, however.

Viduni Wickramarachchi

Using Pinia, an Alternative Vue.js Store â€” If you want to just go straight to the library, hereâ€™s its homepage (cuteÂ logo!)

Daniel Kelly

[Free Download] Guide to Effective Feature Management â€” Learn feature management practices to accelerate release cycles and deploy every 6 hours, instead of every 6Â weeks.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

Get Started with React by Building a 'Whac-a-Mole' Game â€” This is truly aimed at beginners keen to strike some â€˜aha!â€™ moments while learning React. Using it to create a simple game certainly could take you out of your comfortÂ zone.

Jhey Tompkins

Where's The Best Place to Host a Next.js Site? â€” A detailed look at deploying a Next.js app to Vercel, Netlify, Layer0 and Heroku and rating them based upon a variety ofÂ factors.

Ondrej Polesny

A Beginner's Guide to Vue 3
Catalin Pit

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

supported by

Boring Avatars: React Library to Generate Custom Avatars â€” Ranging from generic gradients to face-like creations, this library (GitHub repo) generates custom, SVG-based, round avatars from any username and colorÂ palette.

Boring Designers

CandyGraph: A Fast, Flexible 2D Plotting Library â€” A flexible and fast-by-default 2D plotting library tuned for rendering huge datasets on the GPU at interactive speeds. And if that sounds like a boast, hit up the examples (the animated ones lower down are the mostÂ interesting).

Rye Terrell

Drag-n-Drop Email Editor for React, Angular and Vue

Unlayer sponsor

threads.js: Web Workers Meet Worker Threads â€” Threads is both a terrifying nuclear apocalypse movie and also this library for making using both Web Workers and worker threads (as implemented in Node) as simple as possible. Outsourcing intensive code to other threads can really help in someÂ cases.

Andy Wermke

NocoDB: An Open Source Airtable-a-Like â€” Airtable is a popular commercial spreadsheet-database service that we even use here at Cooperpress to help put the newsletters together. This is a flexible and surprisingly good looking open sourceÂ pastiche with a Vue poweredÂ frontend.

nocodb team

ts-node 10.0: TypeScript Execution and REPL for Node
TypeStrong

eslint-plugin-tailwindcss: ESLint Plugin for Tailwind CSS Usage
Francois Massart

Velociraptor 1.0: npm-Style Script Runner for Deno
JurassiScripts

items.title: Running Node natively in the browser
items.content:
#â€‹539 â€” May 21, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

DOM Events: A Way to Visualize and Experiment with the DOM EventÂ System â€” A visualizer to help you learn about the DOM Event system â€“ not always the easiest thing to get a mental model of â€“ throughÂ exploration.

Alex Reardon

Introducing WebContainers: Run Node.js Natively in the Browser â€” An interesting new WebAssembly-based operating system that boots instantly and enables Node.js environments to run directly in the browser. People have been getting very excited about this on Twitter. Only supports Chromium-based browsers for nowÂ though.

Eric Simons (StackBlitz)

New & Updated Course: Complete Intro to React v6 with Brian Holt â€” Learn to build real-world applications using modern React. Much more than an intro, youâ€™ll start from the ground up, getting to using the latest features in React, including hooks, effects, context, and portals, plus piecing together tools from the entire ReactÂ ecosystem.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Parcel 2 Beta 3: A Wild Rust Appears! â€” How does a â€˜beta 3â€™ release get a feature? By having its JavaScript compiler entirely rewritten in Rust is how. This change yields a â€œ10x fasterâ€ compiler and continues an ongoing trend of writing JavaScript tools in other languages (such as esbuild, written in Go). There is more to the release, though - detailsÂ within.

ParcelJS

Quick Bits

  • Are you ready to shed a tear when Microsoft fully retires Internet Explorer on June 15, 2022?
  • Enjoy this 'snake' game implemented in 27 lines of JS on CodePen.
  • I admit I've not had much time to look at these maps of JavaScript concepts but they make for pretty overwhelming visuals - interesting!
  • The Next.js Conf site is a sort of multiplayer experience. It takes place online on June 15, BTW.

Releases

Node 16.2.0
create-node-cli 1.6.0 â€” Tool to create new Node CLI projects.
lowdb 2.0.0 â€” Tiny local JSON database for small projects.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Lead Frontend Development at Fleet (100% Remote) â€” Work with the creators of Sails.js + osquery at our new venture building a better way to manage employee laptops andÂ servers.
Fleet

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

2D Optics Demos in JavaScript â€” A fun bit of visuals meeting code. These little live experiments areÂ neat.

Philip Zucker

â–¶Â Â A Complete Beginner's Guide to Next.js â€” Ali keeps it engaging and easily digestible in this 22-minute video. Well recorded. Fantastic.

Ali Spittel

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is theÂ Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints andÂ console.log.

Wallaby.js sponsor

How to Create Reusable Web Components with Lit and Vue â€” A thorough walk through creating a button component using the Lit framework for use in a Vue.jsÂ app.

Dan Valinotti

Tree-Shaking: A Reference Guide â€” A high-level, though comprehensive, introduction to what â€˜tree shakingâ€™ is all about. The basic idea is that unused code from modules you use gets â€˜shakenâ€™ off like dead leaves on aÂ tree.

Ãtila Fassina

Embedding Google Forms in a Static Site Without iFrames â€” An approach promising more customizability than embedding a Google FormÂ IFRAME.

Brian May

â–¶Â Â 'TypeScript is Testing' â€” In a 3-minute micro podcast episode, Kent makes the argument that TypeScript is like testing because of the extra confidence it gives you about yourÂ code.

Kent C Dodds podcast

Provision Infrastructure with JavaScript and Pulumi â€” Build, deploy, and manage modern cloud applications and infrastructure usingÂ JavaScript.

Pulumi sponsor

â–¶Â Â Frontend Development in 2021: A Complete Guide â€” A tight 20-minute look at the frontend landscape, covering the libraries and tech youâ€™ll want toÂ know. One worth sharing with anyone you know who's interested in getting into theÂ space.

Harry Wolff

A Guide to Unit Testing Vue Components
Patrick Kennedy

How to Use Tailwind's Just-in-Time Mode in Angular
Amadou Sall

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Typehole: VS Code Tool to Automatically Generate TypeScript Types and Interfaces â€” An extension that helps you automate creating the initial static types for runtimeÂ values.

Riku Rouvila

Sublime Text 4 Released â€” While VS Code has become extremely popular in the past few years, Sublime Text used to be huge and itâ€™s great to see a new major version. TypeScript, JSX and TSX support are baked in, as is Apple Silicon support, GPU rendering, andÂ more.

Sublime Blog

[New] Free JavaScript Code Quality & Security Scanner - Realâ€‘TimeÂ Scan

Snyk sponsor

A Boilerplate for SSRâ€™d Vite, React 17, and TypeScript 4.3 â€” Considers itself a â€œbarebones, slightly-opinionatedâ€ boilerplate for working with a modern webÂ stack.

JonLuca DeCaro

lightGallery: A Well Presented, Modular JS Image and Video Lightbox Gallery â€” Works with React.js, Vue.js, Angular, and TypeScript. Demos here or the GitHub repo. Been around a while but as of this week no longer relies on jQuery! GNUÂ licensed.

Sachin N

Vuestic UI 1.0: A Vue.js 3.0 UI Framework â€” Features more than 50 highly customizableÂ components.

Vuestic UI

ReacType 7.0: A Visual Prototyping Tool for React Developers â€” The popular drag-and-drop React prototyping tool with code preview is now in its seventh major release. Kevin Park has written an extensive article on it which provides an in-depth review of its capabilities.

OSLabs

ğŸ’š Use Node? Check out the latest issue of Node Weekly, our sibling email about all things relating to Node.js â€” from tutorials and screencasts to news and releases. Yep, we do include some Node related items here in JavaScript Weekly, but we save most of it for there.

â†’ Check out NodeÂ WeeklyÂ today

ğŸµÂ And one for fun..

Trombone.js: Yep, It's a Trombone.. â€” I donâ€™t know the first thing about playing the trombone, but here you go. The source is here along with an explanation of how it works. Allegedly it â€œclosely approximates the acoustic properties of (a) real tromboneâ€. I always found the 'pink trombone' vocal synthesizer (yes, itâ€™s safe for work!) aÂ laugh.

Jeffrey Auriemma

items.title: Why Babel needs more money
items.content:
#â€‹538 â€” May 14, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Angular 12 Released â€” Angular is surely turning out to be one of Googleâ€™s most reliable projects and while v12 isnâ€™t exactly a revolution, itâ€™s a strong step down the full transition to Ivy, Angularâ€™s next generation compilation and renderingÂ pipeline.

Mark Techson

'Babel Is Used by Millions, So Why Are We Running Out ofÂ Money?' â€” If you spend much time on Twitter, you may have seen this story take off in a big way after the original creator of Babel (and now Rome) tweeted a (now deleted) thread questioning Babel's use of funds (there was tons of discussion about it on Hacker News, too). Regardless, Babel is a fundamental JavaScript project, its team does a lot of great work, and it's worth supporting â€” we've just donated.

Babel Core Team

How to Pay Down Tech Debt in JavaScript Apps â€” In todayâ€™s fast-paced development world, teams are under pressure to release quickly but that introduces more bugs and tech debt. Discover how leading web teams pay down tech debt to speed innovation and deliver stable apps to users. Watch theÂ webinar.

Bugsnag sponsor

Deno 1.10 Released â€” A nice evolutionary bump for Deno this week with, I feel, the most interesting feature being Web Storage API support. Yes, it's localStorage and sessionStorage but server-side and working much like they do in the browser.. There are big improvements to the testing tools, too. And if you're still unsure about Deno, maybe Minna Niemi's practical 20-minute video will sell you on it.

The Deno Team

Announcing TypeScript 4.3 Release Candidate â€” I recently saw someone opine that frequent releases and improvements correlate to a project's long term success, and if thatâ€™s true, TypeScript is doing great ğŸ˜„ There's a list of tweaks and improvements as long as a K-Mart receipt including import statement completions and template string typeÂ improvements.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

Quick Bits

  • Azure Static Web Apps, Azure's system for building and hosting statically generated sites, is now generally available.
  • It's not exactly JavaScript, but WebAssembly Cloud is an interesting single page experiment for letting you play with WebAssembly directly in the browser using Rust.
  • Google Docs is planning to switch from HTML-based rendering to Canvas-based rendering. It's an interesting development and has many worrying about the accessibility implications. Google offers a demo document if you want to see it in action.

Releases

Docusaurus 2 Beta â€” Elegant documentation site generator.
Cypress 7.3.0 â€” Popular testing system.
postcss-loader 4.3.0 â€” PostCSS loader for webpack.
react-bootstrap 1.6.0 â€” Bootstrap components for React.

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Senior Web Developer (Node/ReactJS) - Remote â€” Millions get inspired and plan adventures with our apps. To help us make komoot.com the place to go to plan outdoor adventures, weâ€™re looking for a one of a kind Web Developer to join ourÂ team.
Komoot

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

Lessons on Writing JavaScript and React from ClojureScript â€” ClojureScript is essentially a Clojure (the Lisp dialect and functional language) to JavaScript compiler and going down the functional path often leads developers to various epiphanies. Ryan is keen to share hisÂ experience.

Ryan Jerue

Performance-Testing the Google I/O Site â€” Another solid performance review from Jake here, this time looking at how the Google I/O site fares on a 3G mobile connection. (Spoiler: Itâ€™s ratherÂ slow)

Jake Archibald

[Free Download] Guide to Effective Feature Management â€” Learn feature management practices to accelerate release cycles and deploy every 6 hours, instead of every 6Â weeks.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

Why JWT Should Not Be Your Default for Sessions â€” â€œMy point in all this is not to discourage the use of JWT in general, but be deliberate and careful when you do. Be aware of both the security and functionality trade-offs andÂ pitfalls.â€

Evert Pot

Migrating From Parcel to Snowpack â€“ A Build Tool Comparison
Ben Frain

Why I Finally Chose React Over Vue
Bill Wohlers

How to Use the Vibration API on Your Site
Bibek Kakati

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

supported by

mo.js 1: A Motion Graphics Toolbelt for the Web â€” We first linked to this six years ago but it only recently hit a 1.0 release. It offers a declarative API and gives you full control over animations. There are several tutorials on offer if you want to see how itÂ works.

Oleg Solomka, Xavier Foucrier, Jonas Sandstedt

Elder.js: An 'SEO-First' Svelte-Based Framework â€” An opinionated static site generator designed for building SEO-friendly sites at scale. We featured this last year, but itâ€™s under active development and has had another push lately. GitHubÂ repo.

Elder.js Team

An Angular Data Grid That Makes Life Easy Does Exist. Give It aÂ Try

Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Prettier 2.3: The Opinionated Code Formatter â€” Not a huge release but a notable milestone is official support for formatting HTML templates written withÂ Handlebars.

Georgii Dolzhykov

Spearmint: A Simpler Way to Test Your React App â€” â€œIn short, this tool generates executable JavaScript test-code based on custom data input from theÂ developer.â€

spearmint.js team

Free Chat & Activity Feed APIs for Qualifying Teams â€” The Stream Maker Account provides qualifying teams with full and free access to Stream's Chat and Activity Feed APIs, making them accessible to side projects and new startups. No credit card isÂ required.

Stream sponsor

Eva.js: A Front-End Game Engine for Creating Interactive Projects â€” Includes components that are ready to use out-of-the-box and it uses PixiJS for performant WebGL rendering. Try it in this live playground. GitHubÂ repo.

EVA

htmr 1.0: HTML String to React Element Conversion Library
Fatih Kalifa

ğŸ“· Â Vision Camera 2.0: A Powerful Camera for React Native Apps
Cuvent Technologies UG

Vuetify 2.5: A Material Design Framework for Vue.js
Vuetify

âš›ï¸ React developer? Check out the latest issue of React Status, our sibling newsletter about all things relating to React from tutorials and screencasts to news and releases. While we do include some React items in JavaScript Weekly, we save most of it for there.
Check out ReactÂ StatusÂ today.
items.contentSnippet:
#â€‹538 â€” May 14, 2021


UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  





  
  
Angular 12 Released â€” Angular is surely turning out to be one of Googleâ€™s most reliable projects and while v12 isnâ€™t exactly a revolution, itâ€™s a strong step down the full transition to Ivy, Angularâ€™s next generation compilation and renderingÂ pipeline.
Mark Techson 


  
  
'Babel Is Used by Millions, So Why Are We Running Out ofÂ Money?' â€” If you spend much time on Twitter, you may have seen this story take off in a big way after the original creator of Babel (and now Rome) tweeted a (now deleted) thread questioning Babel's use of funds (there was tons of discussion about it on Hacker News, too). Regardless, Babel is a fundamental JavaScript project, its team does a lot of great work, and it's worth supporting â€” we've just donated.
Babel Core Team 


  
  
How to Pay Down Tech Debt in JavaScript Apps â€” In todayâ€™s fast-paced development world, teams are under pressure to release quickly but that introduces more bugs and tech debt. Discover how leading web teams pay down tech debt to speed innovation and deliver stable apps to users. Watch theÂ webinar.
Bugsnag sponsor


  
  
Deno 1.10 Released â€” A nice evolutionary bump for Deno this week with, I feel, the most interesting feature being Web Storage API support. Yes, it's localStorage and sessionStorage but server-side and working much like they do in the browser.. There are big improvements to the testing tools, too. And if you're still unsure about Deno, maybe Minna Niemi's practical 20-minute video will sell you on it.
The Deno Team 


  
  
Announcing TypeScript 4.3 Release Candidate â€” I recently saw someone opine that frequent releases and improvements correlate to a project's long term success, and if thatâ€™s true, TypeScript is doing great ğŸ˜„ There's a list of tweaks and improvements as long as a K-Mart receipt including import statement completions and template string typeÂ improvements.

Google Docs is planning to switch from HTML-based rendering to Canvas-based rendering. It's an interesting development and has many worrying about the accessibility implications. Google offers a demo document if you want to see it in action.

items.title: Writing shell scripts with JavaScript
items.content:
#â€‹537 â€” May 7, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

How GitHub Uses and Works with Web Components â€” GitHub has long been a proponent of Web Components with over 17 open-source components available for all to use. Hereâ€™s their story of why they use them and how they buildÂ them.

KristjÃ¡n Oddsson

zx: A Tool for Writing Better Shell Scripts â€” Tired of turning to bash, Python or Ruby to throw together a quick script? Stick with the JavaScript you know and love â€“ this makes it easier with some handy functions for calling other programs, processing their output and results, changing directory, etc.

Google

Document Database. SQL Queries. In-Memory Speed â€” The No. 1 reason developers choose Couchbase? You can use your existing SQL skills to easily query and access JSON. Thatâ€™s more power and flexibility with less training. LearnÂ more.

Couchbase sponsor

AWS Introduces 'CloudFront Functions' â€” Think (very) short running JavaScript functions right within Amazon CloudFront designed to rewrite, redirect, or otherwise work with incomingÂ requests.

Amazon Web Services

Bootstrap 5 Released â€” A big release for the popular CSS framework with numerous JavaScript changes under the hood too, such as no more jQuery(!) and an upgrade to PopperÂ 2.

Mark Otto

Quick Bits

  • SpiderMonkey is Mozilla's long standing JavaScript engine as used in Firefox and other projects. It now has an all new homepage and.. drum roll.. a logo for the first time ever.
  • Ben Beattie-Hood has released Modern TypeScript, an e-book aiming to raise money for the Australian Red Cross. This 18 minute video covers what's in the book.
  • V8 9.1 is on the way. It's one of the less feature packed releases but adds top level await by default (already the case in some users of V8, such as Blink), private brands check syntax by default, and some perf improvements.
  • Up and coming toolchain Rome has formed a company, raised some money,Â hiredÂ folks.
  • A look at what's new in RxJS 7, the reactive extensions for JavaScript.

Releases

node-dev 7.0 â€” Zero-conf Node.js reloading.
Mocha 8.4 â€” JavaScript test framework.
vue-test-utils 1.2.0 â€” Utilities for testing Vue components.
Gatsby 3.4 â€” React based app framework.
Node.js 16.1.0

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Senior Frontend Engineer (Berlin / Remote) â€” Want to join a small startup with a big growing potential (we double every year)? Feather is looking for a frontendÂ engineer.
Feather

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

Dependency Managers Donâ€™t Manage Your Dependencies â€” Christoph Nakazawa has kicked off a new series on JavaScript infrastructure by putting the role of tools like npm, Yarn, or pnpm into context and explaining how you can begin to â€˜take ownershipâ€™ of yourÂ dependencies.

Christoph Nakazawa

Hosting SQLite Databases on GitHub Pages (or Any Static File Host) â€” A clever bit of hacking around here. sql.js provides an SQLite client in the browser but the author wrote a virtual file system addition to fetch chunks of remotely hosted SQLite databases over HTTP. Some interesting potential here, IÂ think.

Phiresky

â–¶Â Â A Comparison of Five React Frameworks â€” In just 26-minutes, this video provides most of the information required to pick the right React framework from five top players in the space: CRA, Gatsby, Next.js, Blitz, and Redwood.

Leigh Halliday

Search Your Code. ALL of it, everywhere â€” Sourcegraph is the one tool to find & fix things across all your code. Any code host, any repo, any language. Try itÂ now.

Sourcegraph sponsor

TypeScript Function Syntaxes â€” The syntax for various functions and function types in TypeScript with simpleÂ examples.

Kent C Dodds

Update URL Query Parameters As You Type in an Input Field â€” For when you want to change the current URLâ€™s query parameters as you type in an input field (such as on a live searchÂ page).

Amit Merchant

Create a Satellite Tracker in 30 Lines of JavaScript â€” Unsurprisingly this is heavy on the dependencies, butÂ neat.

Omar Shehata

â–¶Â Â A Talk About the TC39 Decimal Proposal â€” From Web Engines HackfestÂ 2021.
Caio Lima

Cloning JavaScript Objects with Graph Theory
Andrea Simone Costa

Top Ten git Tips and Tricks
Julie Kent

How We Sped Up Chrome DevTools Stack Traces by 10x
Chrome Developers

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Mantine: A New React Component Library â€” An MIT licensed, TypeScript-based collection of around 60 components and hooks with native dark theme support and a focus on usability and accessibility. Plenty of documentation and examples - we like it. Oh, and they work with PreactÂ too.

Mantine Team

Pts: A Library for Visualization and Creative Coding â€” An impressive, lightweight and modular library, written in TypeScript and compiled to ES6. Plenty of demos to play around with. p5.js is a similar long standing tool in thisÂ space.

William Ngan

Limited-Time Sale: 25% off Wallaby.js and 50% off Quokka.js â€” Breakpoints and console.log is the past, real-time feedback without leaving your editor is theÂ future.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Spotlight: A Lightbox Gallery Library â€” We first linked to this two years ago when it was new, now itâ€™s more mature and boasts as being the â€˜most easy to integrateâ€™ lightbox gallery with no dependencies either. DemosÂ here.

Nextapps GmbH

Useful Tools for Parsing and Annotating PDFs in Node â€” Nothing beats an article by someone whoâ€™s just had to do the thing beingÂ covered.

Jing Fan

Fx: A Command-Line JSON Processing Tool â€” If youâ€™ve got some files full of JSON that you want to process, Fx will slice and dice it however you want, including using JavaScript one-liners to add a bit of logic to theÂ process.

Anton Medvedev

Build, Deploy, and Update Applications Fastâ€”All on the Cloud

OutSystems sponsor

Hammer: An esbuild-Powered Build Tool for HTML Applications â€” The idea is to a TypeScript-centric â€œultra lightweight alternative toÂ Parcel.â€

Haydn Paterson

node-wasm-run: Run Arbitrary WASM/WASI Files on V8
Wasm3 Labs

Observable Plot: A Library for Exploratory Data Visualization â€” GitHubÂ repo.
Observable

ğŸ˜‚Â A fun one.. or is it?

Think about what Math.min() and Math.max() might each return, then test it out.. or cheat and look at this tweet ğŸ˜

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
